alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 16 at 7:46PM PDT until May 16 at 9:15PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Central and Northeast Washington, including the following counties, in North Central Washington, Chelan and Okanogan. In Northeast Washington, Ferry. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Burn scars, steep terrain and urbanized areas with poor drainage will be especially susceptible to flash flooding with thunderstorms. Excessive rain with thunderstorms may also result in debris flows near burn scars or in steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A few slow moving thunderstorms will continue into the evening and will be capable of torrential rainfall with rain rates of up to an inch per hour under the strongest cells. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
